importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred on the night of December 9, 2025, when Robert Brooks was violently assaulted upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility.

keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility, resulting in his death.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.
The body-camera footage, though silent, clearly showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, contributing to public outrage and the prosecution's case.
All guards were accused of acting together as a gang, with prosecutors claiming they showed 'depraved indifference to human life' in their actions.
Brooks had a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault and was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility on the night of the incident.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to legal representation of officers in civil lawsuits.
Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility.
Six of the 10 guards indicted had previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter or misdemeanor charges; three others agreed to reduced charges and are cooperating.
The case highlights systemic issues in prison oversight, use of force, and accountability of correctional officers.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Brooks' death and the graphic body-camera footage of his beating made him a central figure in public outrage and legal proceedings, highlighting the brutality of prison violence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2025. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage, showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, with prosecutors alleging a gang-like assault that demonstrated 'depraved indifference to human life.' While Kingsley was convicted, guards Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though they faced lesser charges of gang assault. The case drew national attention due to the graphic nature of the video and the systemic issues it exposed. Special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick led the investigation after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to conflicts of interest. The case is part of a broader pattern of violence in state prisons, with similar legal actions underway in the fatal beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility in March 2025.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
